means: （通常因悲伤）哭泣( weep的现在分词 )

sentence.Network_en: He is unpredictable, weeping one moment, laughing the next.
sentence.Network_cn: 他喜怒无常，一会儿哭，一会儿笑。

sentence.Network_en: Myrtle sat huddled on the side of the bed, weeping.
sentence.Network_cn: 默特尔缩着身子坐在床边哭泣。

sentence.Network_en: The production received ecstatic reviews and had audiences weeping.
sentence.Network_cn: 那部上演的戏备受好评，让观众潸然泪下。

example.ex: She wanted to laugh and weep all at once...
The weeping family hugged and comforted each other...
example.tran: 哭泣着的一家人相互拥抱并彼此安慰。

entry.def: If a wound weeps, liquid or blood comes from it because it is not healing properly.

example.ex: In severe cases, the skin can crack and weep.
example.tran: 在恶劣的条件下，皮肤可能会开裂并流脓。

example.ex: ...little blisters which develop into weeping sores.

means.word_mean: 1. the process of shedding tears (usually accompanied by sobs or other inarticulate sounds);

sentences.sentence: "I hate to hear the crying of a child"
